lead_paragraph: The Central African Republic’s constitutional court scrapped results from a legislative election, citing irregularities like illegible ballots and poor training for election workers.

headline.print_headline: Africa; Central African Republic: Court Invalidates Legislative Election
headline.main: Central African Republic: Court Invalidates Legislative Election

snippet: The Central African Republic’s constitutional court scrapped results from a legislative election, citing irregularities like illegible ballots and poor training for election workers.
abstract: Constitutional court in Central African Republic certifies presidential election results, setting stage for presidential runoff election between Anicet-Georges Dologuele and Faustin Archange Touadera; court separately invalidates legislative election results, confounding candidates.
